column3: Yes, having this information can't hurt in any case and this might save a roundtrip asking.\nACK\n
What is a graphical shell? Maybe this should be and/or?

> What is a graphical shell?

For example:
- before Ubuntu 18.04 [Unity (user interface)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unity_(user_interface)):
> Unity is a graphical shell for the GNOME desktop environment ... 

- [GNOME Shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNOME_Shell):
> GNOME Shell is the graphical shell of the GNOME desktop environment starting with version 3.

Agree that a

Clarifying here won't explain it to someone submitting an issue. The comment itself needs to be clearer.

Perhaps "graphical shell" is a familiar term for GNOME users, but most KDE users will never encounter it, since almost all use Plasma+KWin.

"*(if relevant)*" sounds good enough.
